title: Lust for Life (Iggy Pop album)
summary: Lust for Life is the second solo studio album by American musician Iggy Pop, released on September 9, 1977, by RCA Records. It was his second collaboration with English musician and friend David Bowie after The Idiot, released in March the same year. Shortly after Bowie released his own album Low in January, Pop went on a tour to support The Idiot with Bowie as his keyboardist. At the tour's conclusion, Pop and Bowie regrouped in Berlin to record the former's next solo album.
